bio:
Westernpunk is a subgenre of speculative fiction that blends the tropes and aesthetics of the Western genre with elements of science fiction or fantasy. Notable visual features include an emphasis on rugged, wild west landscapes, cowboy fashion, and futuristic or supernatural elements. Westernpunk often explores themes of individualism, lawlessness, and the collision of different cultures.

Interesting fact: The television show Firefly is often cited as an example of Westernpunk, blending elements of space opera and the Western genre.
